summary:
Johannesburg, often called Jozi or Joburg, is South Africa's biggest city with over 4.8 million people. It's a global city and the country's business hub, home to many big companies. The city grew quickly after gold was discovered in 1886.

Soweto, once a separate city, is now part of Johannesburg. It was created as a home for Black Africans during apartheid, when racial segregation was law.

Johannesburg hosted the 2010 FIFA World Cup final, showcasing its importance on the world stage.
title: Johannesburg
